> [{quoted}](name=lojician,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wkQKH0Z0,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-03-09T20:21:39.851+0000)
>
> I wouldn't bet on it but I could see him being good against some ranged tops.

I suppose, but he has no real escape mechanism and runs out of mana fairly quickly. If you are going to take a traditional jungler top you are better off with Jarvan.

Reason people don't take jarvan top is because despite poking well and doing well in short trades he doesn't have meaningful sustained dps if he fails to burst something down. So you can eventually just automatically all in him with normal top lane fighters.
I agree...hes already very durable in jg now hes just going to have a quicker early game!

How to buff {{champion:102}} according to Riot:

A whole 0.5% health as magic damage!

If they have 2500 health, this means... ***12.5 EXTRA DAMAGE***

if you think about it, it means that 4 auto attacks will deal 10% of their HP instead of 8%, which actually is quite a buff. her Q also damages 2 times, so that's 5% instead of 4%. I believe that she'll have an easier time dueling with these changes, both early, mid and late, and attack speed is now even more baseline on her.
I don't know if I'd call any of these ideal changes, but you'd be hard pressed to find reason why they weren't at least in the right direction.

Know what our first order of business is? We think sion's laning is too good. Oh and I guess we can nerf that professionally perma-banned top lane mage's q by 5 damage per level."

I guess they didn't like a melee champion being able to out-lane their ranged cancer despite having counterplay oozing out of every one of his skills.

> [{quoted}](name=OkamotoSenpai,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wkQKH0Z0,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-03-09T17:12:22.143+0000)

> And I thought they were going to buff Nautilus. Instead they nerfed his damage and reduced slightly the CD and mana costs. That is BS to me.

Dude, oh my gosh. This is a huge buff. They HALVED the cool down and reduced the mana cost by 20. His E now can be reduced to a 3 second cool down. They also buffed his tankiness and (not listed here) made the jungle tank item more in his favor overall. WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT?

> [{quoted}](name=Inept Maverick,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wkQKH0Z0,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-03-09T17:15:48.022+0000)
>
> Dude, oh my gosh. This is a huge buff. They HALVED the cool down and reduced the mana cost by 20. His E now can be reduced to a 3 second cool down. They also buffed his tankiness and (not listed here) made the jungle tank item more in his favor overall. WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT?

The also cut down the slow time on his Riptide by .75 seconds, so it's just a hair above a second for a slow. It loses damage and utility for "spamability" and a lower mana cost. It's basically just a weaker ability. I'd call it a nerf overall.

> [{quoted}](name=Inept Maverick,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wkQKH0Z0,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-03-09T17:15:48.022+0000)
>
> Dude, oh my gosh. This is a huge buff. They HALVED the cool down and reduced the mana cost by 20. His E now can be reduced to a 3 second cool down. They also buffed his tankiness and (not listed here) made the jungle tank item more in his favor overall. WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT?

I find the CD reduction on the E useless except for farming and he farmed quite well already with his W. In teamfights, having the E every 3 seconds (and that considering that you already got a 40% CDR) doesn't mean much with that small damage (it wasn't even very damagy before...)
I agree the new tank jung item is going to be good for him, but the changes to the champion itself are clearly a nerf. Though I understand they want to avoid turning him op with the new item. But the changes are a nerf (even if overall he might benefit from the patch)

He'll be doing a lot more dmg now. Most people will now max e first and will serve as a constant AOE dmg source in teamfights. It's MUCH more reliable than having his W as his main dmg source becuase his W is usually just destroyed becore he can even fully utilize it. And he'll do even more dmg with that new jungle item.

He'll also have more CC, seeing that he can use his e more than once in a teamfight now. At the same time they increased his tankiness.

IMO this is a HUGE buff to Nautilus.

Bahahaha those Nidalee changes. Don't worry guys, the trap that never killed anyone still won't kill anyone. I'm glad her heal, her low-CD extremely spammable poke, her free execute, and her free spammable escape are balanced.

I really have no issue with these current changes. However I feel the direction league is taking with nerfing anyone who might have an edge in the current meta is counter productive. I understand people may find the game less enjoyable with kassadin deleting your adc off the map and than blinking out. But a lot of the current nerfs are directed in the wrong direction. It's sad how at the beginning of the season there was so much champion diversity and whenever a champion finds a place in the meta he is quickly nerfed out. I think it would be so much funner to have 15 viable jungle picks rather than 3 or 4. The only way to do this is not nerf the champions that we feel are OP. There only OP because there counterparts in the jungle are under powered. Buff champs don't nerf.

{{champion:79}}  Needs different changes. Sure the extra mana is nice but they really need to increase the damage reduction time by 1 second or so. He is not in a terrible spot but he has a tough time with the popular top laners now. I feel like riot wants to push him into the jungle. With the recent changes. They could also lower the time it takes his q to reach full damage by .5 or 1 full second, it still gives people enough time to react to it. Or they could make it so his q gains damage based on the time you let it ferment with the 2 seconds being maximum. He needs a small buff but I am glad they are trying something with him at least.

I personally think that the changes to azir is something that he is in need of, even though there're still some things that could be changed. As an Azir main, i can say that the nerfs he recieved made him too weak to even stand on his own feet, but with an extra 50 range on his soldier's auto-attacks, i feel that he is going to be at least a lot more viable now. Even though the Q (which is pretty much only used to slow and reposition now, except of a more burst based spell in the early game) is a bit weak, i believe that it is needed. Any changes i want to see? I believe a change on his E ratio should be changed. I like the fact that his max health scales the shield, but there's absolutely no reason to get more than 1 item which increases his health (RoA and RcS). i believe if they increased the health ratio a bit, or atleast make it increase with AP (like 0.15 AP ratio or maybe 0.20) would be a great change for him, so that he isn't a total pounching bag, if he decides to do a play with a tasty Q-E-Ult combo.
Overall, i am looking forward to be able to play him again.
